name: biennially
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
once every two years: He believes that the Cricket World Cup should take place biennially, rather than every four years. The society's officers are elected biennially. Compare
annually
biannually
More examplesFewer examplesThis is a student-run symposium held biennially at Yale since 2002.The Kathleen Mitchell Award is a $7500 prize given biennially to encourage Australian authors under 30. The full delegate conference takes place sometimes only biennially. The bill would require the state Department of Corrections to maintain biennially updated photos of each inmate in its custody.
